Topic.Title: Some IBM bigwigs idea to screw fellow employees about 401-K

Message.Msg: International Business Machines Corp. (IBM) said in March 2011 it had settled with U.S. regulators over allegations it bribed Chinese and South Korean officials to win at least $54 million in government contracts.

Message.Title: On the 401K debate
Message.Msg: For a message board, this singular issue has stirred up a real hornet's nest, Ginny better rethink this one, I have never seen a more consistent run of posts on a single subject on ANY board on Yahoo EVER. The anger is real and is showing up here. A few shills like to say that the shareholder value has never been better, which is true but at what COST? The employees are clearly angry about this one. IBM made a mistake and had better correct it.

You betcha it is. We can handle changes in OT rules, medical benefits, downsizing, re-leveling performance criteria and even the elimination of the defined pension plan. But when they start messing with potential gains of the plan that they hyped in replacing the pension plan, they have crossed the line. The "enhanced" 401K is barely in force and they are making drastic changes to it. IBM is still a good company but the penny pinching policies at employee expense is wearing on morale.
